title: China provides government scholarships to Haitian students
description: On August 31, 2018, the China Commercial Development Office in Haiti held a reception to send off the 2018 Chinese government scholarship recipients. Ms. Green, Director-General of the Department of Culture of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China, and Victor, Chairman of the Committee on Development and China Relations in Haiti, attended the meeting. The financial amount of the scholarship is unknown.
staff_comments: Based on the photo of included in the source, nine students were awarded scholarships.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China provides government scholarships to Haitian students

# Description
On August 31, 2018, the China Commercial Development Office in Haiti held a reception to send off the 2018 Chinese government scholarship recipients. Ms. Green, Director-General of the Department of Culture of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China, and Victor, Chairman of the Committee on Development and China Relations in Haiti, attended the meeting. The financial amount of the scholarship is unknown.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Government scholarships for Haitian students, education sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates 200 CDs and textbooks to support Chinese language instruction at the Department of East Asian Studies of the University of Delhi
description: On November 13, 2018, the Chinese Embassy in India donated 200 CDs and textbooks to the Department of East Asian Studies of the University of Delhi to support Chinese language teaching at the university. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Embassy provides a ₹6,000,000 INR grant to renovate two buildings at Cheena Bhavana at Visva-Bharati University
description: In February 2018, the Chinese Embassy in India provided a grant of ₹6,000,000 INR to Visva-Bharati University to support renovations at Cheena Bhavana, the Institute of Chinese Language and Culture at Visva-Bharat. The grant was intended to finance the renovation of two small buildings at the center. While the funds were received by Visva-Bharati University, no funds were used in the 2018-19 fiscal year; it is unclear if implementation began.  Cheena Bhavana was founded by Rabindranath Tagore in 1937 as a center for Sino-Indian cultural studies. In 2020, it had over 200 students enrolled in undergraduate and postgraduate courses on Chinese language and doctoral research on the cultural ties between China and India. As of 2020, Cheena Bhavana had a memorandum of understandings (MoU) with three Chinese universities for exchanges that was to expire in 2022.  In September 2020, after a summer of violent clashes along the Sino-Indian border, the authorities at Cheena Bhavana ceased communications with the Chinese universities, after fears of repercussions from India's University Grants Commission, which had began requesting details of the relationships between Indian universities and Chinese institutions and apparently required Cheena Bhavana to secure its permission before hosting any webinars with Chinese universities.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides a ₹6,000,000 INR grant to renovate two buildings at Cheena Bhavana at Visva-Bharati University

# Description
In February 2018, the Chinese Embassy in India provided a grant of ₹6,000,000 INR to Visva-Bharati University to support renovations at Cheena Bhavana, the Institute of Chinese Language and Culture at Visva-Bharat. The grant was intended to finance the renovation of two small buildings at the center. While the funds were received by Visva-Bharati University, no funds were used in the 2018-19 fiscal year; it is unclear if implementation began.  Cheena Bhavana was founded by Rabindranath Tagore in 1937 as a center for Sino-Indian cultural studies. In 2020, it had over 200 students enrolled in undergraduate and postgraduate courses on Chinese language and doctoral research on the cultural ties between China and India. As of 2020, Cheena Bhavana had a memorandum of understandings (MoU) with three Chinese universities for exchanges that was to expire in 2022.  In September 2020, after a summer of violent clashes along the Sino-Indian border, the authorities at Cheena Bhavana ceased communications with the Chinese universities, after fears of repercussions from India's University Grants Commission, which had began requesting details of the relationships between Indian universities and Chinese institutions and apparently required Cheena Bhavana to secure its permission before hosting any webinars with Chinese universities.
justification: Project focuses on education facility renovation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Grant for renovation of educational buildings at Chinese language and culture institute

title: China donates solar water pumping system to India in 2018
description: On June 10th, 2018, Consul General Zheng Xiyuan attended the handover ceremony of the solar water pumping system under China-India Solar Technology Innovation Poverty Alleviation Demonstration Project. When the system is at full power, more than 700 cubic meters of water can be pumped every day, benefiting more than 1,200 people and more than 800 hectares of land in the three villages where the project is located.
staff_comments: The Chinese name of this project is 中印太阳能科技创新扶贫示范项目.It is unclear when China committed to build this project.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China donates solar water pumping system to India in 2018

# Description
On June 10th, 2018, Consul General Zheng Xiyuan attended the handover ceremony of the solar water pumping system under China-India Solar Technology Innovation Poverty Alleviation Demonstration Project. When the system is at full power, more than 700 cubic meters of water can be pumped every day, benefiting more than 1,200 people and more than 800 hectares of land in the three villages where the project is located.
justification: Primary purpose is solar-powered water pumping, directly utilizing renewable energy
evidence: Solar water pumping system, renewable energy application for water supply

title: Bank of China contributes $150 million to $1.62 billion syndicated loan to PLN for 35,000MW electricity program (Linked to Project ID#92462)
description: On October 25, 2018, financial close was reached on a deal in which a syndicate of 19 lenders — including Bank of China (Hong Kong) Limited (BOCHK), ICBC Indonesia, and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (Asia) Limited — entered into a $1.62 billion USD syndicated loan agreement with PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara (Persero) (PLN) — an Indonesian state-owned corporation with a monopoly on electric power distribution in Indonesia — for general corporate purposes. The syndicated loan agreement consisted of term loan facilities worth $1.32 billion with a five-year tenor as Tranche A and a revolving credit facility worth $300 million with a three-year tenor as Tranche B. Tranche A carries a margin of LIBOR plus 92.32 basis points (offshore) or 102.32 basis points (onshore) and has an average tenor of 4.18 years, while Tranche B carries a margin of LIBOR plus 75 basis point (offshore) or 85 basis points (onshore) and has an average tenor of 2.83 years. The transaction offered a top-level, all-in pricing of LIBOR plus 107.87 basis points (offshore) or 117.87 basis points (onshore) for lenders participating in Tranche A only, and a blended top-level all-in pricing of 105.8 basis points (offshore) or 115.8 basis points (onshore) for participation in both tranches.  BOCHK, Australia and New Zealand Banking Group (ANZ), Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd (OCBC Bank), Citigroup Global Markets Singapore Ltd, Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC) Singapore Branch / PT Bank Sumitomo Mitsui Indonesia, and United Overseas Bank Limited served as the senior mandated lead arrangers and bookrunners.  ICBC Indonesia, ICBC Asia, and 13 other lenders —  Bank of Taiwan, Cathay United Bank, DZ Bank, E.Sun Commercial Bank, First Abu Dhabi Bank, Hokkoku Bank, Hyakugo Bank, Hua Nan Commercial Bank, Land Bank of Taiwan, Mega International Bank, State Bank of India, and Shanghai Commercial and Saving Bank — joined in syndication. The loan was launched into general syndication in July 2018 at an initial size of $1.5 billion USD with a $500 million USD greenshoe option, that was boosted to $1.62 billion USD after 13 lenders joined during syndication.  BOCHK contributed $150 million USD to the loan syndicate, as captured via Project ID#61050. ICBC Indonesia and ICBC Asia also jointly contributed $150 million ISD, as captured via Project ID#92462.  The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan for general corporate purposes. Specifically, to finance the construction of power plants as a part of the implementation of the Government of Indonesia’s 35,000-megawatt (MW) generation program. The power program supported by this syndicated loan was launched by President Joko Widodo’s administration in 2014. The program was announced in 2014 by President Jokowi. He planned to add 35,000 MW of new generating capacity to Indonesia’s electric grid — by developing power plants (both conventional and renewable) — no later than the end of his first term in 2019. As of December 31, 2019, 19% ( 6,811MW) of the 35,000 MW program has been realized. President Director of PT PLN (Persero) Zulkifli Zaini reported that power plants under construction have a total capacity of 20,167.8 MW, equivalent to 57%. 6,877.6 MW (20%) are in the process of power purchase agreement (PPA) negotiation. 2% are in the procurement phase (829 MW) and 2% are in the planning phase (734 MW). In April 2019, PLN secured Rp 16.75 trillion ($1.18 billion) in syndicated loans from seven local financial institutions for the flagship 35,000MW electricity program.
staff_comments: 1. It is not clear in which tranche(s) ICBC Asia and ICBC Indonesia participated; therefore, AidData has assumed for the time being that the interest rate corresponds to the blended top-level all-in pricing of LIBOR plus 105.8 basis points (offshore). AidData uses average 6-month LIBOR rate from the syndicated loan agreement date on October 25, 2018 (2.687%) and adds the margin (105.8 basis points) to estimate the all-in interest rate (3.745%).  2. For the time being, AidData assumes a maturity length of 4 years.  3. On June 8, 2018, PLN appointed several banks as Mandated Lead Arranger and Bookrunners (MLABs), including Bank of China, Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd, Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd (ANZ Banking Group), Citigroup Global Markets Singapore Ltd, Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC) Singapore Branch / PT Bank Sumitomo Mitsui Indonesia, Mizuho Bank, and United Overseas Bank Limited.
combined_text:

In April 2019, PLN secured Rp 16.75 trillion ($1.18 billion) in syndicated loans from seven local financial institutions for the flagship 35,000MW electricity program.
justification: Loan for general corporate purposes to support power plant construction, including both conventional and renewable energy sources
evidence: 35,000MW generation program includes both conventional and renewable power plants, loan for general corporate purposes

title: China Eximbank provides $130.3 million preferential buyer's credit for Phase 3 of Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road Project (Linked to Project ID#61325, #39363)
description: On May 7, 2018, China Eximbank and the Government of Indonesia signed a $130,387,425.76 preferential buyer's credit (PBC) agreement for Phase 3 of the Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road Project (captured in Project ID#61397).   Funding for Phase 1 of the Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road was signed on November 12, 2012 between the China Exim Bank and the Government of Indonesia worth $92,999,886.66 in preferential buyer's credit (PBC) [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO. (2012) 35 TOTAL NO. (223)] (captured in Project ID#61325). The PBC, which went into effect on March 11, 2013, carried the following terms: 15-year maturity, 3-year grace period, 3% interest rate, and 0.2% management fee. On March 3, 2016, the closing date of the PBC agreement was extended from March 11, 2016 to August 28, 2017. Then, on August 28, 2017, the PBC agreement was again extended from August 28, 2017 to December 21, 2017. As of December 21, 2017, $84,693,920 of the $92,999,886.66 PBC had been disbursed.  On June 13, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Indonesia signed a $219,398,580 preferential buyer's credit (PBC) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO (2015) TOTAL NO (389)] for Phase 2 of the Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road Project (captured in Project ID#39363). The PBC, which went into effect on September 30, 2016, carried the following terms: 15-year maturity, 3-year grace period, 3% interest rate, 0.2% commitment fee, and 0.2% management fee. The closing date of this PBC agreement is June 13, 2021.  The Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road — also known as the Cisumdawu Toll Road —  is a road that, upon completion, will pass through Cileunyi, Tanjung Sari, Sumedang, Cimalaka, Legok, Ujung Jaya and Kertajati. It will connect Padaleunyi Toll Road with Palimanan-Kanci Toll Road. It will also connect Bandung with Kertajati International Airport, which opened in 2018. The road is being built in 6 sections. Section I (or Phase 1): Cileunyi–Tanjungsari (12.0 km); Section II (or Phase 2): Tanjungsari–Sumedang (17.5 km); Section III (or Phase 3): Sumedang–Cimalaka (3.7 km); Section IV (or Phase 4): Cimalaka–Legok (7.2 km); Section V (or Phase 5): Legok–Ujungjaya (15.9 km); and Section VI (Phase 5): Ujungjaya–Dawuan (4.0 km).   A consortium of Chinese and Indonesian companies — including the Shanghai Construction Group, Wijaya Karya and Waskita Karya — are responsible for building all the sections of the toll road. However, the Indonesian Ministry of Public Works and Housing, China MCC17 Group Co Ltd, and MCC Overseas Ltd are also involved in project implementation. A formal project commencement ceremony took place on November 29, 2012. As of June 2019, the project was still under implementation. The project was originally expected to be complete by end-2021. On January 15, 2021, the head of the West Java Transportation Office, Hery Antasari, said the toll road project has been held up by the slow process of land clearing on Section VI. In a written statement on Monday, January 24, 2022, West Java Governor Ridwan Kamil said the Cileunyi - Sumedang - Dawuan or Cisumdawu toll road construction project will be finished and connected to the Cipali Toll Road in June 2022.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Cisumdawu Toll Road Project. The Chinese project title is 万隆高速路 or 又称芝苏达乌公路 or 团印尼芝苏达乌公路项目 or 吉松达乌收费公路三期项目.
combined_text:

Funding for Phase 1 of the Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road was signed on November 12, 2012 between the China Exim Bank and the Government of Indonesia worth $92,999,886.66 in preferential buyer's credit (PBC) [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO. (2012) 35 TOTAL NO. (223)] (captured in Project ID#61325). The PBC, which went into effect on March 11, 2013, carried the following terms: 15-year maturity, 3-year grace period, 3% interest rate, and 0.2% management fee. On March 3, 2016, the closing date of the PBC agreement was extended from March 11, 2016 to August 28, 2017. Then, on August 28, 2017, the PBC agreement was again extended from August 28, 2017 to December 21, 2017. As of December 21, 2017, $84,693,920 of the $92,999,886.66 PBC had been disbursed.  On June 13, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Indonesia signed a $219,398,580 preferential buyer's credit (PBC) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK PBC NO (2015) TOTAL NO (389)] for Phase 2 of the Cileunyi-Sumedang-Dawuan Toll Road Project (captured in Project ID#39363). The closing date of this PBC agreement is June 13, 2021. A formal project commencement ceremony took place on November 29, 2012. As of June 2019, the project was still under implementation. The project was originally expected to be complete by end-2021. On January 15, 2021, the head of the West Java Transportation Office, Hery Antasari, said the toll road project has been held up by the slow process of land clearing on Section VI. In a written statement on Monday, January 24, 2022, West Java Governor Ridwan Kamil said the Cileunyi - Sumedang - Dawuan or Cisumdawu toll road construction project will be finished and connected to the Cipali Toll Road in June 2022.
justification: Toll road construction project with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Road infrastructure project connecting multiple locations, no renewable energy or energy transition components mentioned

title: ICBC contributes Rp 366 billion to syndicated loan for Cikopo-Palimanan toll road
description: On September 17, 2018, the Bank ICBC Indonesia provided Rp 366 billion in debt financing as part of a syndicated loan to PT Lintas Marga Sedaya with a total financing agreement of Rp 8.88 trillion. The financing will be used for refinancing and funding the construction of the BIJB Kertajati Airport Link Toll Road from the Cikopo-Palimanan toll road.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
ICBC contributes Rp 366 billion to syndicated loan for Cikopo-Palimanan toll road

# Description
On September 17, 2018, the Bank ICBC Indonesia provided Rp 366 billion in debt financing as part of a syndicated loan to PT Lintas Marga Sedaya with a total financing agreement of Rp 8.88 trillion. The financing will be used for refinancing and funding the construction of the BIJB Kertajati Airport Link Toll Road from the Cikopo-Palimanan toll road.
justification: Project is focused on transportation infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Toll road construction and refinancing, airport link project

title: ICBC contributed IDR 400 billion in an IDR 4.5 trillion syndicated loan for Pekanbaru-Dumai Toll Road Project in Indonesia
description: In 2018 Bank ICBC Indonesia contributed IDR 400 billion in the syndicated financing of IDR 4.5 trillion to PT Hutama Karya to finance the construction of Pekanbaru-Dumai toll road in Riau province ("Sustaining the Momentum to Forge Ahead."). Other members of the syndicate include the Tanjung Priok Access Toll Road monetization system of PT Permata Bank, Tbk., MUFG Bank, Ltd. (Jakarta Branch), and PT Sarana Multi Infrastructure (Persero). The financial terms of the loan are unclear.  PT Hutama Karya partnered with PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur (SMI) to finance the project. PT Kanta Karya Utama assessed environmental impact, PT Cipta Strada Engineering Consultants were civil engineers, and REDS Consultants were traffic consultants for the project. Badan Pengatur Jalan Tol (BPJT) is undertaking the construction of the road.   The road links Pekanbaru and Dumai in Riau, Indonesia, and it is part of the Trans-Sumatra Toll Road Network. Groundbreaking of construction of this toll road was done in 2013. ("Pekanbaru–Dumai Toll Road") Pekanbaru-Dumai toll road is divided into six sections with a total investment of Rp16.21 trillion that is set to be finished by 2020. By November 2019, the construction progress of all sections reached 74.2%. ("Late 2019, 501 km of Trans-Sumatra toll road operational: Kayu Agung-Palembang toll road to be inaugurated soon"). On September 22, 2020, the road was been completed and inaugurated by President Joko “Jokowi” Widodo (Jokowi inaugurates first toll road in Riau).
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
ICBC contributed IDR 400 billion in an IDR 4.5 trillion syndicated loan for Pekanbaru-Dumai Toll Road Project in Indonesia

# Description
In 2018 Bank ICBC Indonesia contributed IDR 400 billion in the syndicated financing of IDR 4.5 trillion to PT Hutama Karya to finance the construction of Pekanbaru-Dumai toll road in Riau province ("Sustaining the Momentum to Forge Ahead."). Other members of the syndicate include the Tanjung Priok Access Toll Road monetization system of PT Permata Bank, Tbk., MUFG Bank, Ltd. (Jakarta Branch), and PT Sarana Multi Infrastructure (Persero). The financial terms of the loan are unclear.  PT Hutama Karya partnered with PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur (SMI) to finance the project. PT Kanta Karya Utama assessed environmental impact, PT Cipta Strada Engineering Consultants were civil engineers, and REDS Consultants were traffic consultants for the project. Badan Pengatur Jalan Tol (BPJT) is undertaking the construction of the road.   The road links Pekanbaru and Dumai in Riau, Indonesia, and it is part of the Trans-Sumatra Toll Road Network. Groundbreaking of construction of this toll road was done in 2013. ("Pekanbaru–Dumai Toll Road") Pekanbaru-Dumai toll road is divided into six sections with a total investment of Rp16.21 trillion that is set to be finished by 2020. By November 2019, the construction progress of all sections reached 74.2%. ("Late 2019, 501 km of Trans-Sumatra toll road operational: Kayu Agung-Palembang toll road to be inaugurated soon"). On September 22, 2020, the road was been completed and inaugurated by President Joko “Jokowi” Widodo (Jokowi inaugurates first toll road in Riau).
justification: Project is a toll road construction with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Toll road construction, part of Trans-Sumatra Toll Road Network, no mention of renewable energy or environmental focus

title: ICBC contributed Rp400B to syndicated financing of Semanan – Sunter – Pulogebang Toll Road in Indonesia
description: On November 28, 2018, ICBC Indonesia participated in syndicated financing to PT JTD Jaya Pratama for Rp400 billion from a total syndicated financing of Rp14.5 trillion for the construction of Semanan – Sunter – Pulogebang toll road. According to JTD President Director Frans Sunito, the loan syndicate consists of 29 banks, the tenor is 15 years with an interest rate of 11 percent for development and 10.75 percent interest at the time of operation. The construction of the 31.16 km toll road will be divided into 3 (three) sections, namely: Section A (Kelapa Gading – Pulo Gebang Section) spanning 9.30 kilometers, Section B (Semanan – Grogol Section) spanning 9.50 kilometers, and Section C (Grogol – Kelapa Gading Section) spanning 12.4 kilometers. PT JTD Jaya Pratama is a project company for PT Jakarta Tollroad Development (JTD), a consortium founded by 12 companies with the majority owned by PT Pembangunan Jaya.  This is Phase 1 of the Jakarta Elevated Toll Road. Construction started in February 2017 and was set to be complete by 2022 ("Jakarta Elevated Toll Road"). The Jakarta Elevated Toll Road is comprised of 6 elevated toll roads in Jakarta with a public transportation lane and connected to Jakarta Inner Ring Toll Road with a total length of 69.77 kilometers. The entire project is broken down into three phases. Phase 2 (Duri Pulo—Kampung Melayu spanning 12.65 kilometers and Kemayoran—Kampung Melayu spanning 9.60 kilometres) is targeted to be in operation by early 2021. Phase 3 (Ulujami—Tanah Abang spanning 8.70 kilometers and Pasar Minggu—Kasablanca spanning 9.16 kilometers) is set to be operational by mid-2022.  On August 23, 2021, President Joko Widodo inaugurated the Section A (Kelapa Gading - Pulo Gebang) toll road. Minister of Public Works and Public Housing (PUPR) Basuki Hadimuljono also updated that the construction of Sections B & C of Phase 1 is targeted to be completed in 2024.   The construction of this toll road was previously targeted for completion in 2019 but has stalled due to several problems. First, land acquisition in urban areas, relocation of high-voltage air lines (SUTT - 150 Kv), and other utilities such as gas pipelines, clean water pipes, medium-voltage cable lines, and distribution/network lines. Head of BPJT of the PUPR Ministry, Danang Parikesit, stated that the Covid-19 pandemic in early March 2020 and the implementation of Large-Scale Social Restrictions (PSBB) in DKI Jakarta have also affected the speed of implementation of construction work in the field.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
ICBC contributed Rp400B to syndicated financing of Semanan – Sunter – Pulogebang Toll Road in Indonesia

# Description
On November 28, 2018, ICBC Indonesia participated in syndicated financing to PT JTD Jaya Pratama for Rp400 billion from a total syndicated financing of Rp14.5 trillion for the construction of Semanan – Sunter – Pulogebang toll road. According to JTD President Director Frans Sunito, the loan syndicate consists of 29 banks, the tenor is 15 years with an interest rate of 11 percent for development and 10.75 percent interest at the time of operation. The construction of the 31.16 km toll road will be divided into 3 (three) sections, namely: Section A (Kelapa Gading – Pulo Gebang Section) spanning 9.30 kilometers, Section B (Semanan – Grogol Section) spanning 9.50 kilometers, and Section C (Grogol – Kelapa Gading Section) spanning 12.4 kilometers. PT JTD Jaya Pratama is a project company for PT Jakarta Tollroad Development (JTD), a consortium founded by 12 companies with the majority owned by PT Pembangunan Jaya.  This is Phase 1 of the Jakarta Elevated Toll Road. Construction started in February 2017 and was set to be complete by 2022 ("Jakarta Elevated Toll Road"). The Jakarta Elevated Toll Road is comprised of 6 elevated toll roads in Jakarta with a public transportation lane and connected to Jakarta Inner Ring Toll Road with a total length of 69.77 kilometers. The entire project is broken down into three phases. Phase 2 (Duri Pulo—Kampung Melayu spanning 12.65 kilometers and Kemayoran—Kampung Melayu spanning 9.60 kilometres) is targeted to be in operation by early 2021. Phase 3 (Ulujami—Tanah Abang spanning 8.70 kilometers and Pasar Minggu—Kasablanca spanning 9.16 kilometers) is set to be operational by mid-2022.  On August 23, 2021, President Joko Widodo inaugurated the Section A (Kelapa Gading - Pulo Gebang) toll road. Minister of Public Works and Public Housing (PUPR) Basuki Hadimuljono also updated that the construction of Sections B & C of Phase 1 is targeted to be completed in 2024.   The construction of this toll road was previously targeted for completion in 2019 but has stalled due to several problems. First, land acquisition in urban areas, relocation of high-voltage air lines (SUTT - 150 Kv), and other utilities such as gas pipelines, clean water pipes, medium-voltage cable lines, and distribution/network lines. Head of BPJT of the PUPR Ministry, Danang Parikesit, stated that the Covid-19 pandemic in early March 2020 and the implementation of Large-Scale Social Restrictions (PSBB) in DKI Jakarta have also affected the speed of implementation of construction work in the field.
justification: Project is focused on transportation infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Toll road construction project, no mention of renewable energy or energy transition components
